headline: Gold Price Rises. Why Trump Tariff Fears Could Drive It Even Higher.
summary: The price of gold was rising to start the week as heightened uncertainty about U.S. trade policy boosted the appeal of havens.  Continuous gold futures  rose by 1.8% to $5,165 per ounce in early trading Monday.  Silver futures  meanwhile, rallied 5.1%.

headline: 'Sit still and do nothing': Trump's latest tariff salvos leave markets unfazed
summary: Asia stocks were mostly higher, safe-haven assets stayed firm, with yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury little changed, while gold inched about 1% higher.
